meanings.definition: To climb or move awkwardly or with difficulty, typically using both hands and feet.
meanings.sent1: The little kitten clambers up the tree to chase a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: She clambers over the rocks to reach the top of the hill.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy squirrel clambers up the bird feeder, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: As the hiker clambers up the steep trail, each step feels like a victory.
meanings.sent5: The toddler clambers onto the chair, giggling with excitement.

meanings.definition: A noisy, confused, or disorderly situation.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was a clambers of students talking and laughing.
meanings.sent2: After the concert, the venue turned into a clambers of people trying to leave.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party became a clambers of kids running around and playing games.
meanings.sent4: The market was a clambers of vendors shouting prices and customers bargaining.
meanings.sent5: The construction site was a clambers of machinery noise and workers shouting instructions.
